results.title: Mambush: the craftsman and the artist
results.creator_credit: Callner Film Productions and Jerry A Callner
results.brief_description: Master craftsman Yitzhak Mambush describes and demonstrates the results of blending of the painters and tapestry maker’s talents. Visiting the artistic community of Ein Hod, Israel, where Mambush works, the process of preparing for weaving is shown. Mambush characterises his translation of the painters art into a tapestry as not simply a reprise of the canvas.

results.title: Mamadrama
results.creator_credit: Amber Films, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen, Arte and Monique Schwarz
results.brief_description: An Australian documentary examining the portrayal of Jewish mothers on the big screen. From an early age filmmaker Monique Schwarz was puzzled by the discrepancy between the domineering and emasculating Jewish mothers typically represented on film, and her own mother, a Holocaust survivor. “Mamadrama” consequently has a strong personal touch, via the reflections of Schwarz and interviews with directors Paul Mazursky, Paul Bogart, and Larry Peerce, and actress Lainie Kazan. In addition to well-known Hollywood movies “Mamadrama” uses rare footage from early silent films, Yiddish language features and Israeli films. The tone of the documentary is reflective rather than critical; the most intriguing moments emerge from the candour with which the interviewees discuss their own mothers.

results.title: Mama Tina
results.creator_credit: Gumleaf Productions, December Films, Steve Jeffares and Stuart Menzies
results.brief_description: Irish mother Christina Noble has a special identity to the homeless children of Vietnam, she is known as Mama Tina. Driven by her grim childhood in Dublin, Christina moves through the streets and rubbish dumps in search of lost children. The stories related to and filmed by writer-director Steve Jeffares about Mama Tina are a testament to her love for children and her philosophy that all children are entitled to education, health care and love.

results.title: Maltese Flamingo
results.brief_description: A wonderfully wild’n’wacky ski film taking top honours at Vail’s ski film festival. Follow the adventures of 12 ski bums as they take on some of the greatest ski terrain in Europe and North America. Incredible ski action, great music gives `Maltese Flamingo’ the necessary punch to be one of the classic ski films of all time. Rated: G

results.title: Malpractice
results.brief_description: Malpractice is an emotional portrayal of a family’s efforts to come to terms with the result of medical malpractice; and a mother’s need to find out the truth. While most of the characters in this dramatic docu-drama are portrayed by actors, some hospital staff play themselves. The members of the legal profession are all practising solicitors and barristers. The findings of the tribunal are not scripted, but determined by the presentation of the case.

results.title: Mallee - land of challenge
results.creator_credit: Soil Conservation Authority of Victoria and R.G. Downes
results.brief_description: How the Mallee farmer is overcoming the problems of former bad land use and wind erosion by modern agricultural methods. Soil conservation competitions, educational field days, and advisory services also are helping the farmer to improve land use. The film shows how this vast Mallee country has a big production potential for cereals, wool and meat.

results.title: Mallboy and sound design
results.brief_description: Speakers: Philip Brophy (Sound Designer) Vincent Girusso (Director/Writer) Fiona Eagger (Producer) discussing the decisions they made for the sound design of ‘Mallboy’. This was a presentation for Cinesonic conference 2000 filmed for research purposes only.

results.title: Mallboy
results.creator_credit: Twenty Twenty, Australian Film Commission, SBS Independent, Showtime, Fiona Eagger and Vincent Giarrusso
results.brief_description: Shaun (Kane McNay) is a fifteen year old living in the northern suburbs of Melbourne. His mother (Nell Feeney) refuses to grow up, his father is in prison, and Shaun himself is in and out of foster care. For Shaun, going through the emotional and physical effects of adolescence, his only escape is hanging out at the local mall. Though “Mallboy” doesn’t shy away from a gritty examination of working class and unemployed lives in contemporary urban Australia, it also manages to find great humour and compassion in Shaun’s relationships with friends and family. This realist Australian film, the debut feature by Melbourne musician Giarrusso (who is a member of the Underground Lovers), is influenced by both Italian neo-realism and the socialist humanism of English filmmakers such as Ken Loach and Mike Leigh. Kane McNay won a special youth award at the 2001 AFI Awards. The sound design is by Philip Brophy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Twenty Twenty, Australian Film Commission, SBS Independent, Showtime, Fiona Eagger and Vincent Giarrusso

results.title: Malice in wonderland
results.creator_credit: ITC Productions, Jay Benson and Gus Trikonis
results.brief_description: The story of one of Hollywood’s most memorable and often bitter rivalries between Hedda Hopper (Jane Alexander) and Louella Parsons (Elizabeth Taylor). This made for television docudrama, based on the book “Hedda and Louella” by George Eells, is full of drama and comedy as these two very powerful women vie with each other to get the latest gossip or scandal in the glitzy Hollywood world of stars and stardom. Cast also includes Richard Dysart, Joyce Van Patten, Jon Cypher.
